H0.text: What was the capital of Poland prior to Warsaw. Krakow

H1.text: What was the capital of Poland prior to Warsaw. Gniezno

H2.text: What was the capital of Poland prior to Warsaw. Poznan

H3.text: What was the capital of Poland prior to Warsaw. PLKRK

A4.text: Gniezno was the first historical capital of Poland in the 10th century and early 11th century.

A5.text: The cities of Gniezno and nearby Poznań were captured, plundered and destroyed in 1038 by the Bohemian duke Bretislav I, which pushed the next Polish rulers to move the Polish capital to Kraków.

A6.text: The unrest led to the transfer of the capital to Kraków in 1038 by Casimir I the Restorer.

A7.text: The transfer of the capital to Kraków in 1038 by Casimir I the Restorer indicates that Kraków, not Gniezno, was the capital prior to Warsaw.
